stimulusHtml: A industrial/organizational psychologist finds a .50 correlation between college grades and income at age 30. Which of the following interpretations of these data is correct?
choicesHtml: Earning good grades in college causes higher incomes in adulthood.
Good grades in college and high incomes are related.
Half of the income of employees who are age 30 can be explained by their college grades.
There is no relationship between college grades and income at age 30.
